intro: Stigmaphyllon lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate stigmaphyllon, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its stems are woody and often have a hairy texture. It is typically found in humid, tropical environments, growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas of the forest understory.
